meanings.definition: To entangle or involve in a mesh or net.
meanings.sent1: The spider tried to immesh the fly in its web.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally immeshed my hair in the brush.
meanings.sent3: The silly puppy managed to immesh itself in a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to immesh in a confusing tangle.
meanings.sent5: The vines immeshed the fence, creating a natural barrier.

meanings.definition: To catch or ensnare in a trap or snare.
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up a clever trap to immesh the elusive rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman hoped to immesh a big catch in his net.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to immesh the cat in a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The detective worked hard to immesh the criminal in his lies.
meanings.sent5: The spider managed to immesh its prey in a sticky web.
